$BMNR down more than 10%  üò≥

$BMNR now holds about 3% of all Ethereum.

They added ~97K $ETH last week binging their total to ~3.73M.

Michael Burry went on Substack saying $TSLA is ‚Äúridiculously overvalued‚Äù & that Musk‚Äôs comp plan will keep draining shareholders. 

He also took a swing at what he calls the ‚ÄúElon cult‚Äù saying they rotate from EVs to autonomy to robots whenever competition shows up. 

He already has big positions against $NVDA & $PLTR so the entire post is filtered through a view that AI is just another hype cycle. 

If you think AI is a bubble then Burry sounds convincing but if you understand the scale of what‚Äôs actually being built then his take feels like it‚Äôs coming from a market that doesn‚Äôt really exist anymore.

A rough start to December for crypto

‚Ä¢ $BTC -7%
‚Ä¢ $ETH -8%
‚Ä¢ $SOL -9%

SoftBank‚Äôs CEO Son says he only sold $NVDA to free up cash for OpenAI because he thinks superintelligence will replace at least 10% of global GDP.

it‚Äôs a reminder of how early we still are in this cycle and how big the model layer could get.

$GOOGL is teaming with Foxconn to build AI servers around TPUv7 Ironwood, with Foxconn supplying the full compute-tray rack for every TPU rack.

Foxconn wants to hit 2K per week by late 2026 which shows Google is scaling its training footprint much faster than most realize.
Welp not exactly the follow-through you want after telling everyone at Thanksgiving dinner that Bitcoin $BTC would clear $100K by year-end.

Elon Musk is saying the value in this cycle concentrates where intelligence is created & where it‚Äôs manufactured. 

$GOOGL spent a decade assembling the deepest AI stack on Earth while $NVDA remains the toll-collector on every marginal unit of intelligence created.

If AI & robotics end up dwarfing the rest of the economy then it‚Äôs because these two sit at the points where all the value concentrates.
$TSLA Elon Musk saying Bitcoin is the first currency whose backing isn‚Äôt political trust but raw energy.

TD Cowen on $TSLA (Buy, PT $509)

"We had an opportunity to take 3 Tesla RoboTaxi rides in Austin last week, covering nearly 40 miles over ~2 hours at a $1.08 price per mile. Rides were impressive all around, with two notably complex scenarios (emergency vehicles and a construction site) handled very well. Does Tesla seem to be on track to begin removing Austin safety monitors by year-end? We think so. Maintain Buy, $509 target."

Blackrock made more money on Bitcoin ETFs than you did.

Few understand this.

I prayed this morning for forgiveness.

I‚Äôm going to commit the sin of annoying the fuck out of you because my thesis from two years ago around Japan sparking a global credit event may finally be right.

I prayed with all my might.
Just woke up what I miss
Do i understand right that you are the reason bitcoin dropped 5%?
STOP STEALING MY SHIT GROK

Dear God.

I pray you forgive me.

I am going to get so annoying that I hope you forgive me for how annoying.

God please forgive me.
It‚Äôs not because a lot of those posters insulted and attacked me. Made it personal. And now they are all saying what I said first.
Maybe I will.

The initial thesis was yields would spike alongside stocks falling as Japan raises dollars by selling Treasuries to support the Yen, but the second phase would be a return to classic risk-off as stock declines accelerate and the flight to safety returns to long duration.
